programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: We present to you historic image and film documents from the Porsche 550 RS Spyder. And: how the Audi Quattro shocked its competitors with its driving dynamics.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: High-tech turbo cars from the wild 1980s are reunited at the Salzburgring race track. Also: the Lancia Beta Monte Carlo, a small Italian two-seater with mid-engine offers classic car driving pleasure at a low entry price.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The 1947 Triumph 1800 Roadster provides space for 5 fresh air fans. Also: Le Jog, the toughest classic car rally in Europe. A German women's team takes on the challenge in their VW Iltis. And: a charming oldie, the 1919 Wolseley Stellite.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: With the M3, BMW brought race car technology to the road. In addition: 120 years of Mercedes-Benz motorsports history. And: turbo power in the DTM. The Ford Sierra RS Cosworth taught its racing competition the meaning of fear.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: Cars like the Ford GT 40, the Jaguar D-Type or the Mercedes 300 SL wrote history on the race track and now break records at auctions. A sumptuously restored 300 SL will start at the most famous classic car rally in the world, the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Audi Quattro
programme.desc: Advantage through Technology on rally tracks. The Audi Quattro shocks opponents.

programme.title: Ford GT40
programme.desc: With their V8 cars, Ford showed that they were able to build race winners. The Ford GT40 was a prime example for that, especially in Le Mans.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: We took the Ferrari 458 Italia for a spring ride around Lake Starnberg. Also: a test drive of BMW's 6 series convertible at the Table Mountain in South Africa. And: the Chevrolet Orlando family van.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: Audi built only 333 units of its GT model. We tested the everyday use compatibility of the R8 GT. In addition: the Mazda MX5, the most popular roadster in the world. And: the Mercedes-AMG GT3.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: More efficiency, less weight and more sportiness is what Audi promotes in order to win the race against BMW and Mercedes with their A6 2.0 TDI. Also: Patrick Dempsey and his racing team at the Grand Am Rolex Sportscar GT series.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: We put the Wiesmann MF5 at the racetrack in Spa-Francochamps in the Belgian Ardennes to the test. Also: Audi A1 vs. Mini Cooper RS. And: the GT Academy 2011 qualifying rounds.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The Nurburgring 24 Hours is considered the most difficult long distance race in motor sports. Volkswagen set themselves this challenge with a car built especially for this occasion, their Golf 24.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The Mercedes-Benz SL 65 AMG is the ultimate German muscle car in a tailor-made suit. Also: the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG, the Formula 1 safety car. And: BMW's 6 series models.

programme.title: Jaguar D-Type
programme.desc: The high-achiever at the 24 hours of Le Mans. The Jaguar D-Type won the toughest endurance race in the world three times in a row.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: If you decide to purchase the Volkswagen Polo GTI or Citroen's DS4 SoChic you neither have to give up convenience nor performance. Also: Nissan doesn't hold back when it comes to their luxury brand Infiniti. We took the Q50 hybrid RWD to the test.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Not only in the big cities it's a growing struggle for parking spots. . We took the BMW X6, the Citroen Cactus and the Smart forfour to town in order to find out how these cars would cope in this situation and surrounding.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Cars with a rear-wheel drive are usually considered to be agile but also a bit capricious in regards to their handling. Does this also apply to the Porsche GT3 and the Smart? In addition: the sporty midsize sedan model range, BMW's 3 Series.

programme.title: The Dubai Police Force's Special Cars Unit
programme.desc: For the first time the Dubai Police special cars unit allows a TV crew to accompany their officers on patrol. These aren't normal police cars because this is not a normal city.

programme.title: Beradino
programme.desc: A „bella macchina“, a beautiful car - but not designed by masters like Bertone or Pininfarina. Johannes Paulussen from Neuss in Germany built the Beradino by hand.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: We test drove the Rallye Defender and examined how a Jeep Wrangler with only few modifications can double in price. Also: how does the Fiat Panda 4x4 fare in Iceland? Also: Land Rover's Bowler Defender and Volvo's 6-wheeler, the Laplander.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: We spent a day in snowy Austria with rally professional Niki Schelle in a Suzuki SX4 S-Cross. Also: why is the Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution perfect for drifting? And: Mercedes and Chrysler present their all-wheel concept cars.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: We show how to have a lot of fun on gravel roads in a Subaru WRX STI. Also: in the 1990s, Ford had a successful go at rally competitions with the Ford Escort RS Cosworth. And: the Volkswagen Polo WRC shows its 4x4 skills.

programme.title: Arabella Classics
programme.desc: Rare Automobiles and stunning views! The Arabella Classics, one of the most exclusive Classic Car Rallies in Europe.

programme.title: Porsche Ruf RT35
programme.desc: Ruf RT35 may look like a Porsche, but it really isn't. Since 1981, the Ruf company in Pfaffhausen, Germany, has been recognized as an independent manufacturer. But the basis for its vehicles comes exclusively from Porsche. A Ruf is even faster and more exclusive than a comparable Porsche.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.sub-title: Chevy Camaro vs Mercedes SLS AMG
programme.desc: Hosts Mylene Gomera and Saif Hattawi invite petrol heads from the Middle East to bring their tuned cars to the 'The Walk' at Jumeirah Beach and have it rated in the categories speed, style and sound. Whoever receives the most points, wins a one night stay for two people at this glamorous Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. On this episode, a Chevrolet Camaro and Mercedes SLS AMG try to impress.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: If you want to see out-of-this-world, customized or tuned luxury vehicles or posh cars you need to go to 'The Walk', the glamorous boulevard of Jumeirah Beach. Put Your Car on TV invites car owners to have their vehicles judged by Saif Hattawi. The person with the most points wins a special treat from the Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. Among the presented cars are a BMW X5 and a Mercedes SLK 230.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: People from the Middle East are crazy about their cars. On Put Your Car on TV they have the chance to present their tuned vehicles and judged. They are awarded points based on speed, style and sound and the car owner with the most points, wins a special treat for two from the Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. Among the competitors are a Nova SS, a special Honda Acord and a car full of crystals.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Mercedes Sprinter, 2018
programme.desc: The Mercedes Sprinter belongs to the class of commercial vehicles. The light transporter is the dream for every tradesman. The third generation Sprinter is sleeker, more modern and more variable than ever.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: In 1964, Ferruccio Lamborghini set himself the goal to build the best sports cars in the world, a bold move, being located only a few kilometers from Ferrari.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: After the Second World War, following in his father's footsteps who had been responsible for the development of the classic Volkswagen, Ferry Porsche laid the foundation for the brand's sports car models like the 356 and later the Porsche 911.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: One cannot talk about rally sports without mentioning the name Walter Röhrl. From an early age, Röhrl showed his talent in rally sports and won the European, World and other international rally championships several times in his career.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: Hans-Joachim Stuck is one of the best racing drivers in Germany. Over his long career he not only won the Formula II and several international touring car championships multiple times but also the famous 24-hour race of Le Mans twice.

programme.title: Ford GT40
programme.desc: With their V8 cars, Ford showed that they were able to build race winners. The Ford GT40 was a prime example for that, especially in Le Mans.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: The BMW X5M, Audi Q7, Mercedes GLS and Porsche Cayenne Turbo are among the strongest and fastest SUVs in the world. Sports utility vehicles made in Germany are the embodiment of technical perfection, superior performance and unique comfort.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: Luxury, lifestyle and exclusivity, no other cars transport these attributes better than the SUVs by Jaguar, Range Rover, Bentley, Volvo and Infinity. These stylish and excellently equipped SUVs embody a spirit of adventure and a zest for life.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: US SUVs and pickup trucks like the Cadillac Escalade, Chevrolet Tahoe, Ford Raptor or Dodge Ram are large, powerful and luxurious and exude the feeling of unlimited possibilities and adventure.

programme.title: Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10
programme.desc: The Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10 has its origins in the Japanese army. Its shape won’t win any beauty contests or achieve the best results in the wind tunnel, but this is not really the point with an SUV like this.

programme.title: Ford GT40
programme.desc: With their V8 cars, Ford showed that they were able to build race winners. The Ford GT40 was a prime example for that, especially in Le Mans.

programme.title: Aston Martin Rapide S
programme.desc: Aston Martin is breaking new ground with the sport sedan – the „Rapide S“. Ever since the official car of James Bond became the Aston Martin, this brand has achieved cult status. Desirable, timelessly elegant, 2-door sports coupes are the DNA. But even the venerable British brand does not escape evolution - because with the Rapide S, Aston Martin goes new ways.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: What better way is there to celebrate a stylish and powerful car and a sunny summer day than going for a cruise over the Alps to Italy in a Maserati GranCabrio MC? In addition: a Brit with a fiery temperament, the Jaguar XK-RS convertible with 550 hp. And: Mercedes AMG's SL models, uncompromising performance.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.sub-title: On Patrol with the Dubai Police
programme.desc: In a city that loves to show off wealth and luxury, the Dubai police are eager to represent this image via its fleet of patrol cars that includes a Chevrolet Camaro, a Lamborghini Aventador, a Bentley GT, a Ferrari FF, an Aston Martin and a Mercedes SLS. For the first time ever, the Dubai Police Special Cars Unit allowed a television crew to accompany them on their service missions.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Aerodynamics crucially influence the performance, track stability and dynamics of a vehicle. We took the Porsche 911 Turbo S, the BMW M6 convertible and the Kelleners 330d to the test and explored the influence of different wings and spoilers.

programme.title: Audi R8 V10 plus
programme.desc: The second generation of the Audi R8. V10 naturally aspirated engine, up to 610 horsepower and 330 kilometers an hour. A supercar with a lot of character.

programme.title: Audi RS7 Sportback Performance
programme.desc: The Audi RS7 Sportback performance is the spearhead of the Audi 7 series with the acceleration values of a super sports car. But it cannot play to its strengths in hectic urban traffic.

programme.title: Volvo Laplander 6x6
programme.desc: More extremes are always possible. Volvo's Laplander army vehicle has 6 wheels, 3 axles and provides space for at least 12 soldiers.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: Once again it was time for the VLN Endurance Racing Championship. While the drivers were doing their test laps, we had a look behind the scenes and explored what went on in the pit lanes.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: The fourth race of the VLN season is usually regarded as a dress rehearsal for the 24-hour race. For the top teams and best drivers it is the last opportunity for a really thorough test.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: We present the highlights of last week. The 24 hour race was exciting, as usual. In addition, we explored the 'Strong Man Run' and took a look at the tourist drivers

programme.title: BMW 503
programme.desc: The noble four-seater 503 convertible was one of BMWs most exclusive models in the 1950s. Many international sports and movie stars and other wealthy customers were fond of this sporty luxury vehicle.

programme.title: Volvo S90
programme.desc: It looks sportier than one might expect from the Swedes. The taillights frame the powerful looking rear. On the inside, the Volvo S90 impresses with the finest materials and soft nappa leather.

programme.title: Alfa Romeo 6C 2500SS
programme.desc: Founded in 1910, the iconic Italian car manufacturer Alfa Romeo experienced a very eventful history. Their 6C 2500 SS model is right in the middle of the company's more than 100-year history. It combined new technology with an early post-war appearance.

programme.title: Mustang
programme.desc: The Ford Mustang Shelby GT-500 was born of the 1960's vibe and the racing experience of Carroll Shelby. Its "boulevard cruiser" style and powerful engine made this muscle car one of the highest sellers of its time.

programme.title: Corvette
programme.desc: The 1963 Split-Window Stingray Coupe combined power, performance, precision and youthful design. Its unique, sleek and progressive look has kept it a perennial favorite with auto enthusiasts and collectors.

programme.title: Oldsmobile
programme.desc: The Oldsmobile F88 was a GM "dream car" with sleek, sophisticated styling, but it never reached production. After many decades, there is one to be seen, and how and why it is finally available to view is a story in itself!

programme.title: Pierce Arrow
programme.desc: 1913 38C Brougham - "built up to a standard, not down to a price" - was worth the value of several houses at the time, with the special cachet of being the first car owned by the White House.

programme.title: Duesenberg
programme.desc: The 1930 Model J Duesenberg was the pinnacle of automotive engineering in power and speed, holding records not surpassed until the 1960's. Magnates like Hearst, the King of Spain and the movie star Gary Cooper owned Duesenbergs.

programme.title: Terraplane
programme.desc: The Hudson Terraplane 1937 Series 72 was a fast and affordable car with unique style and innovative design. But the cars were also reliable and well built, so the company, unlike others, survived the Depression.

programme.title: Chevrolet Corvair
programme.desc: Despite a production number of nearly 1.4 million units the Chevrolet Corvair is virtually unknown in Europe. It was innovative, efficient, modern and cheap. Nevertheless, it was slandered, torn apart and later reviled.

programme.title: Jaguar E-Type
programme.desc: On 15 March 1961 an E-Type Coupe was presented to the press at the Geneva Motor Show. The response to the shrill Jaguar was mostly positive. In Geneva alone, 500 E-Types were ordered. However It was initially not clear whether the E-Type could be presented in Geneva at all, because the car was finished so late that test driver Norman Dewis had to race the exhibit from Coventry to Geneva in the shortest time.

programme.title: Bentley S2 Continental Flying Spur
programme.desc: Flowing lines and an elegance that is unmatched. The 1959 Bentley S2 Continental Flying Spur aims to build bridges in the company's model range. From the sporty origin of the brand to the luxury of its new owner, Rolls Royce.

programme.title: Citroen DS
programme.desc: La Déesse. The goddess of Citroën. This car caused an uproar when it was presented in 1955 at the Paris Motor Show. The DS was the first sedan with disc brakes and hydropneumatic suspension, and its design was simply divine.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.sub-title: Chevy Camaro vs Mercedes SLS AMG
programme.desc: Hosts Mylene Gomera and Saif Hattawi invite petrol heads from the Middle East to bring their tuned cars to the 'The Walk' at Jumeirah Beach and have it rated in the categories speed, style and sound. Whoever receives the most points, wins a one night stay for two people at this glamorous Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. On this episode, a Chevrolet Camaro and Mercedes SLS AMG try to impress.

programme.desc: If you want to see out-of-this-world, customized or tuned luxury vehicles or posh cars you need to go to 'The Walk', the glamorous boulevard of Jumeirah Beach. Put Your Car on TV invites car owners to have their vehicles judged by Saif Hattawi. The person with the most points wins a special treat from the Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. Among the presented cars are a BMW X5 and a Mercedes SLK 230.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: People from the Middle East are crazy about their cars. On Put Your Car on TV they have the chance to present their tuned vehicles and judged. They are awarded points based on speed, style and sound and the car owner with the most points, wins a special treat for two from the Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. Among the competitors are a Nova SS, a special Honda Acord and a car full of crystals.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Mercedes Sprinter, 2018
programme.desc: The Mercedes Sprinter belongs to the class of commercial vehicles. The light transporter is the dream for every tradesman. The third generation Sprinter is sleeker, more modern and more variable than ever.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: In 1964, Ferruccio Lamborghini set himself the goal to build the best sports cars in the world, a bold move, being located only a few kilometers from Ferrari.
